name: curveball
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in the sport of baseball, a throw in which the ball curves as it moves towards the player with the bat: With his curveball, you know it's coming, but you still can't do anything with it. He was pitching for the Braves, and he threw just about the best curveball I'd ever seen. His dream of playing baseball for the St. Louis Cardinals ended with the realization that he couldn't hit a curve ball. Compare
breaking ballSynonym
curve
(US also curve) something such as a question or event that is surprising or unexpected, and therefore difficult to deal with: Every so often life will throw you a curveball. We all know someone who is dealing with a midlife curveball. The damning report threw the administration a curve ball.
